xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: This work is supported by the National Natural Science Foundation of China (11401606 and 11501015), University of Macau (MYRG2015-00058-L2-FST), and the Macao Science and Technology Development Fund (FDCT/099/2012/A3 and FDCT/031/2016/A1).

head.citation-title: Uncertainty principle for measurable sets and signal recovery in quaternion domains
head.abstracts: Copyright © 2017 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.The classical uncertainty principle of harmonic analysis states that a nontrivial function and its Fourier transform cannot both be sharply localized. It plays an important role in signal processing and physics. This paper generalizes the uncertainty principle for measurable sets from complex domain to hypercomplex domain using quaternion algebras, associated with the quaternion Fourier transform. The performance is then evaluated in signal recovery problems where there is an interplay of missing and time-limiting data. Copyright © 2017 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.

translated-sourcetitle.$: Mathematical Methods in the Applied Sciences
